results.title: Fire and ice [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Polyc International, Ralph Bakshi and Frank Frazetta
results.brief_description: This animated feature is set in a mythical Ice Age, where, Juliana, a powerful Queen of the North, seeks to gain control the rest of the realm. In this realm also resides the good King, Jarol, who lives in his fortress of fire and his sworn enemy, evil ice Lord Nekron, who lives with his army of subhumans amongst the glaciers. Nekron uses his powers of sorcery to create havoc and orders the subhumans to kidnap Jarol’s daughter. Thus a war is waged between fire and ice in a desperate battle for survival. Jarol, with help from the warrior hero Darkwolf must save mankind from the apocalyptic icy grave that awaits them if evil is to reign. Featuring the voices of Stephen Mendel, Maggie Roswell, Leo V. Gordon and Steve Sandor. Director Ralph Bakshi is best known for his animated adult feature “Fritz the cat”.

results.title: Finding Nemo [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Pixar Animation Studios, Graham Walters and Andrew Stanton
results.brief_description: A beautifully colourful and enchanting computer animated feature about a father clown fish, Marlin, searching the vast ocean near Sydney for his lost son, Nemo. Marlin pairs up with Dory (voice provided by comic Ellen DeGeneres) who suffers short-term memory loss and Nemo finds himself in a fish tank in a dentist’s office. The experiences the father and son have provide the viewer with an action-packed, sometimes fearsome and fun-filled adventure. (Please Note: some scenes may frighten young children)

results.title: Finding Nemo
results.creator_credit: Pixar Animation Studios, Walt Disney Pictures, Graham Walters and Andrew Stanton
results.brief_description: When Nemo, a young clownfish, is unexpectedly carried far from home, his father Marlin, and Dory, a friendly but forgetful regal blue tang fish embark on an epic journey. Features the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem DaFoe, Brad Garrett.

results.title: Finding Forrester [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Laurence Mark Productions, Fountainbridge Films, Laurence Mark, Sean Connery, Rhonda Tollefson and Gus Van Sant
results.brief_description: Basketball star and ‘C’ student Jamal Wallace (Rob Brown) surprises everyone except himself when his amazing writing abilities and basketball prowess attract the attention of a Manhattan private school. Outside his old school in the Bronx lives a reclusive old man (Sean Connery) who Jamal meets when, on a dare from his friends, enters the building and is frightened when he encounters the man the students call, “The Window”. In his haste to escape he leaves behind his backpack, only to have it returned the following day with comments written in his personal writing notebooks. Jamal returns to the apartment and slowly wins the trust of the old man who convinces him to attend the new school and learn all he can about himself. Inspired by his new mentor, he agrees, and it is at this school that he discovers that the short-tempered old man who has been helping him improve his writing is actually Pulitzer prize winning author William Forrester, a man famous for only ever writing one book. Cast also includes F. Murray Abraham, Anna Paquin, Busta Rhymes and a special cameo appearance by Matt Damon.

results.title: Final Cut
results.creator_credit: Segma Limited, Dominic Anciano and Ray Burdis
results.brief_description: Film makers Dominic Anciano and Ray Burdis have created an original rumination on friendship which blurs the line between documentary and fiction. Jude Law is a recently deceased film maker whose latest film is screened to his grieving family and friends on the day of his funeral. The group is shocked to find that over the last year Jude has in fact been filming them, using hidden cameras to record their most private moments and guilty secrets. Embarrassment gradually turns to fear as the film peels back the layers of their lives, each more treacherous than the last. With liberal use of improvisation and a tour-de-force performance from Ray Winstone, ‘Final Cut’ is a contemporary exploration of morality, mortality and the power of the recorded image. Cast also includes Sadie Frost, Dominic Anciano and Ray Burdis.

results.title: Figures in a landscape
results.creator_credit: Cinecrest, John Kohn and Joseph Losey
results.brief_description: A helicopter, hovering, swoops, wheels and searches like some malignant mechanical bat. Below two men, their hands tied behind their backs, flee for their lives. MacConnachie, played by Robert Shaw, is forty and Ansell, played by Malcolm McDowell, is in his early twenties. Ahead lies 400 miles of hostile terrain they must cross to escape. Between each other lies a deep mutual mistrust, but they are bound by a common need to escape and survive. MacConnachie moves by instinct and Ansell by reason. On and on the two men are hunted by the unrelenting helicopter, and unlike ordinary men who would keep running, they hunt back.

results.title: Fight club [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Fox 2000, Regency Enterprises, Linson Films, Art Linson, Cean Chaffin, Ross Grayson Bell and David Fincher
results.brief_description: Edward Norton is Jack, a young urban professional with the right job, the right furniture and the right bank account who is so bored and filled with self-disgust at his vapid consumerism that he attends support groups for people dying from various diseases in order to experience some form of human contact. Jack’s life is turned upside down when he meets Tyler Durden (Brad Pitt) who introduces him to the “fight club”, a secret society of men who meet in underground clubs to beat the pulp out of each other. Before long Jack, under the influence of the magnetic Tyler, finds himself commandeering a terrorist organisation committed to smashing the American corporate state. Based on Chuck Palahniuk’s cult novel, director David Fincher deploys a swirling, kinetic and audacious mise-en-scene to represent the fragmented and hyper-alienated psychology of contemporary American society. Though the violene in the film is extreme, “Fight Club” is a highly satirical commentary on machismo and masculine insecurity. On its release, “Fight Club” was severly criticised for its elusive and contradictory politics; but contradiction is the essence of the society that the film examines. So this is a virulent anti-Capitalist movie financed by one of the world’s largest media multinationals’ this is a feminist film that exalts in masculine aggression; this is a film that postulates that materialism has goen too far while utilising every state-of-the-art digital special effect available. It is always, however, exhilirating and provocative. Cast includes: Meat Loaf, Jared Leto and Helena Bonham Carter. Original soundtrack by The Dust Brothers.

results.title: Fight club
results.creator_credit: Fox 2000, Regency Enterprises, Linson Films, Art Linson, Cean Chaffin, Ross Grayson Bell and David Fincher
results.brief_description: Edward Norton is Jack, a young urban professional with the right job, the right furniture and the right bank account who is so bored and filled with self-disgust at his vapid consumerism that he attends support-groups for people dying from various diseases in order to experience some form of human contact. Jack’s life is turned upside down when he meets Tyler Durden (Brad Pitt) who introduces him to the “fight club”, a secret society of men who meet in underground clubs to beat the pulp out of each other. Before long Jack, under the influence of the magnetic Tyler Durden, finds himself commandeering a terrorist organisation committed to smashing the American corporate state. Based on Chuck Palahniuk’s cult novel, director David Fincher deploys a swirling, kinetic and audacious mise-en-scene to represent the fragmented and hyper-alienated psychology of contemporary American society. Though the violence in the film is extreme, “Fight Club” is a highly satirical commentary on machismo and masculine insecurity. On its release “Fight Club” was severely criticised for its elusive and contradictory politics; but contradiction is the essence of the society that the film examines. So this is a virulently anti-Capitalist movie financed by one of the world’s largest media multinationals; this is a feminist film that exalts in masculine aggression; this is a film that postulates that materialism has gone too far while utilising every state-of-the-art digital special effect available. It is always, however, exhilarating and provocative. Cast includes Meat Loaf, Jared Leto and Helena Bonham Carter (terrific as Jack’s resilient chain-smoking s ometimes-girlfriend, Marla). Original soundtrack by The Dust Brothers.

Original soundtrack by The Dust Brothers.

results.title: Fierce creatures
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Fish Productions, Jersey Films, Michael Shamberg, John Clesse, Robert Young and Fred Schepisi
results.brief_description: Fierce creatures saw the re-teaming of the creative force behind the smash hit “A fish called Wanda”. Kevin Kline plays Rod McCain, a Rupert Murdoch type figure whose business acumen pays no mind to the human factor, but is keenly interested in the bottom line; Kline also plays his sleazy and corrupted son, Vince. When Rod acquires a quaint English zoo, Vince and Willa Weston, an executive in the McCain empire, travel to England to oversee the proceedings. The amiable Rolo Lee, who runs the zoo, strives to keep his job by achieving the 20% profit margin that McCain requires and calm disgruntled staff. Predictably, mayhem ensues as conflicting agendas wreak havoc at the zoo. Despite the multifarious talents of the filmmakers, “Fierce creatures” is only sparingly amusing, drawing on gross cultural and gender stereotypes. It panders excessively to the view that all Americans are brash and gauche, and that Englishmen are bumbling, sexually repressed sensitive types. At times the sexism of the screenplay truly grates, with Jamie Lee Cutis in the thankless role of Weston, presumably a sharp minded businesswoman, with a proclivity for skimpy outfits that display ample decolletage. Also stars Michael Palin as a loquacious zookeeper, Ronnie Corbet, Robert Lindsey and Carey Lowell.

results.title: Fiddler on the roof
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Mirisch Corporation and Norman Jewison
results.brief_description: A marvellous film version of the Jerry Bock/Sheldon Harnick Broadway musical. It tells the story of an impoverished Russian-Jewish family headed by Tevye (played by Topol), the village milkman, and his wife, Golda. Their three eldest daughters seek husbands of their own choosing rather than those chosen by the village matchmaker. Then a cruel anti-Jewish pogrom forces the family to flee to America and start a new life. The musical was itself adapted from Shalom Aleichem’s story, “Tevye and his Daughters”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United Artists Corporation, Mirisch Corporation and Norman Jewison
